question: Cassidy Daley. Talk to me.
answer: It's Jimmy. Tell me you love me.

question: Depends on what you got.
answer: I've got a confirmed place and time.

question: I love you! So, when? Where?
answer: You think I'm gonna say this shit over the phone? I could get killed. Just meet me at the usual place. Oh, and Cass? This one's gonna cost an extra hundred.

question: Where ya going?
answer: Hooters. I go there for the hot wings.

question: Please. Nobody goes there for the hot wings. You got a tip.
answer: You got a hundred bucks on you?

question: Now are you gonna let me in on it?
answer: Sorry. No can do. I have to protect my source.

question: You know what? We need to talk about our relationship.
answer: We don't have a relationship. We made out 3 years ago in the copy room. I was drunk. I was broken- hearted. I would have made out with the xerox machine.

question: Yes, but you made out with me.
answer: I have to go.

question: I want in on that story!
answer: Hey, Jimmy, I... Jimmy? Let go of me, I'm a reporter, I'm warning you...

question: You said "please set fires in my bar". Wait, no, that's not right. "Please don't set fires in my bar". Ok, jeez, you try to get in the holiday spirit... That's the beauty of my job, Crystal. Tracking down idiots is something you can do pretty much anywhere. See, there's one... And there's another one... And there's... I don't believe it. That idiot. Save my seat.
answer: There you are, you dipshit.

question: Yeah, you. Rudolph. Come here, you fucking ding-dong.
answer: We have to stop meeting this way.

question: Not now, Dwight.
answer: You owe my boss money.

question: Release the reindeer! Hands behind your head, asshole!
answer: Take it easy, skippy, I'm just doing my job.

question: Bounty hunter. Figures. Why don't you get a real job?
answer: So I can be like you patrol boys and sit around all day with my thumb up my ass?

question: Yeah. I know this asshole. Guy used to be one of us. Look, Milo, I know this is a tough time of year for you...
answer: This isn't a tough time of year for me. It's Christmas. Who doesn't love Christmas?

question: ...and I try to be sensitive to your situation...
answer: What situation? Being a man who works his own hours and has his freedom and lives the high life?

question: ...because I realize you're unhappy.
answer: Unhappy? Are you kidding me, Bob? Look at me

question: That sign is pretty hard to see.
answer: AAAHHH!

question: Ok, I got one for ya So. Have you talked to her lately?
answer: Talked to who?

question: Katie Couric, motherfucker, who do you think?
answer: I haven't talked to her in three years, why would I talk to her now?

question: Well, for one thing, so you can stop taking out your rage on innocent bystanders. Do what you want. But this kind of shit will eat a hole in your intestines, you don't deal with it. Hey, why don't you come by the precinct tomorrow for our Xmas bash?
answer: I'm not invited. I'm not a cop anymore, remember?

question: Fuck that, I'm inviting you.
answer: I don't know, Bob. I'm sorta busy.

question: That's what I'm worried about. Just...take it easy, Ok?
answer: Do I look like I need advice from a grown man in antlers?

question: You're drooling on my sofa. You do have an apartment, don't you? With a bed of some kind? Heard you shut down 5th Street yesterday. Gave every kid in the county the gift of nightmares.
answer: Hey, I'm a giving kind of guy. Anyway, what do you care? I brought your guy in, right?

question: You gonna give me a hand, or just stand there killing your liver?
answer: Is that a trick question?

question: So I told her, fine, I'd handle Xmas this year. I mean, what's to handle? You buy a tree, some gifts, cook a ham, hang some lights. An idiot could do it.
answer: Well, we'll soon find out.

question: You have plans for the holiday?
answer: The usual.

question: Gonna drink some cheap whiskey and put your fist through a wall?
answer: Jealous?

question: Then forget it.
answer: Forget what?

question: I've got an open bond, but your thing sounds like more fun. I'll give it to Doug instead.
answer: Whoa. Hold up, Heidi. What the fuck. I want the job, I'm in the hole.

question: You're always in the hole.
answer: What's your point? Hey. I just woke up. I was gonna shower.

question: Ok. But remember
answer: No.

question: Yes.
answer: No.

question: Yes.
answer: No.

question: Are we done yet?
answer: Is this a joke? Because if it is, I'm gonna have to kill you.

question: It's not a joke.
answer: She got arrested? And then she jumped bail?

question: Apparently the whole thing started with some reckless driving, and ended with her assaulting a police officer.
answer: Yeah. That sounds like her. But here's my question

question: Hey, I know she dumped you...
answer: Whoa. She did not "dump me". No, not "whatever". I dumped her.

question: The point is, I'm aware you guys have issues, but I'm running a business here. A person needs bail, I don't have time to check with you first.
answer: Well, had you checked with me first, you wouldn't be out of a bond right now.

question: I'm not out of a bond if you go pick her up. It's five grand to bring her back by 9am, Xmas day. You're a good listener. I take it you're interested.
answer: I love you! You're the best friend a guy could ever have!

question: Right. Sorry. You know what this is, don't you? Karma! Payback! You know how they say "What goes around comes around"? Turns out it's true!
answer: I can't believe you guys broke up over a stupid article.

question: We didn't break up over a stupid article. We broke up because she is a cheating, manipulative liar.
answer: Are you sure you can handle this?

question: Why wouldn't I be able to handle this?
answer: Let's face it

question: ...so, I heard a noise in here and became concerned...
answer: Wrong. Try again.

question: Ok, the truth is she asked me to pick up her dry-cleaning...
answer: You sleeping with her, Stu?

question: You mean, like, at this moment?
answer: Yeah, that's what I mean. Are you sleeping with her at this very moment?

question: We have a history, yes.
answer: A "history", huh? Good luck with that.

question: Here, kitty kitty... Aahh!
answer: You're not Jimmy.

question: Oh. No. I'm looking for him.
answer: Under the sofa?

question: Maybe you can help. I'm his girlfriend. Yes. That's my name. LaKeesha.
answer: Maybe I should call the cops.

question: Wait! Ok, look
answer: What kind of trouble? Money trouble? Drug trouble? Sex- change trouble?

question: Something like that. All I know is, he's missing.
answer: I've had a lousy week, too. My cousin Linda fell off a cruise ship.

question: Oh. I'm sorry.
answer: Hey. A grown woman outta know how to swim.

question: I hear ya. Anyway. Mind if I take a quick look around?
answer: Jimmy's behind on his rent. I bet his girlfriend would want to take care of that.

question: The thing is, Stu, she'll make you think she's interested in you, when really all she's interested in is the case you're working on, because she wants to launch her big hot- shot career.
answer: Wait a second

question: Really?
answer: Oh yeah, dude. She hates you.

question: Oh, she hates me?
answer: Yeah. She says you're the most selfish, immature, stubborn... Hey, man, I'm on your team.

question: No you're not, Geraldo. I don't allow reporters on my team. And for the record That figures. Run home to mommy. Well, nice meeting ya, Stu.
answer: Wait, where are you going?

question: ...and this loser she's dating looks like he buys his clothes from Kmart.
answer: Why do you care?

question: I don't. I just think it's funny.
answer: Hilarious. Listen to me

question: I know that. You don't have to tell me that.
answer: Relationships aren't about competition, they're about compromise.

question: You mean like when your wife wants to do one thing, and you want to do another, and you compromise by doing what she wants?
answer: Exactly. Now just get her here. Cause I can't afford to lose this bond.

question: Happy to see you, too.
answer: How dare you...after what you did to my baby...

question: Ok. What say we do this inside? What happened to the pirate show?
answer: I got sick of it. Now I'm a female impersonator.

question: But...you are female.
answer: That's why I'm so good at it. Help me with this.

question: Where is she, Lois? I need to talk to her.
answer: Oh, Milo, where did it all go wrong? Do you have any idea what it means to waste a woman's child- bearing years? It's criminal. Every month her eggs are jumping out of her ovaries like sailors abandoning a sinking ship. I mean, I know you were mad about that article...

question: I wasn't mad about that article. In fact
answer: Listen to me, Milo

question: Devastated her right to the top. She got to tour the White House? Tell me where she is, Lois.
answer: Oh, who knows. She was running around like a chicken with its head cut off, said she was on the biggest story of her career. Said she was going somewhere to think.

question: Dammit.
answer: No one with that name? What about a casino? Nothing? Thanks. Jimmy?

question: No, who's Jimmy?
answer: Look, Stewart, I'm busy.

question: Ok. Where are you, by the way? I mean, exactly.
answer: I'm in Miami, if you must know. I'm on the beach building a sand castle and drinking from a coconut...

question: I'm in Miami, if you must know. I'm on the beach building a sand castle and drinking from a coconut...
answer: Hello, Cass.

question: Hello, Milo.
answer: Fancy meeting you here.

question: Yeah. Fancy that.
answer: How are you?

question: Fine. You?
answer: Swell. Nice day.

question: Bright.
answer: Brisk.

question: Crisp.
answer: Invigorating.

question: What are you doing here?
answer: "Building a sand castle, drinking from a coconut". Man, once a liar, always a liar.

question: You know what? I don't have time for this, I'm working.
answer: Working? Hey, me too.

question: Congratulations. Move your leg.
answer: What I do is, I track down criminals. People who jumped bail. Idiots who decided to go on the run after biting police officers. I find them, and I take them to jail.

question: Now, hold on just a second, Milo...
answer: Tell you what Strike one. Strike two. Strike three. Get in.

question: I'm not going to jail, Milo.
answer: I beg to differ.

question: Oh please. Like you're gonna shoot me.
answer: Nope. I'm gonna shoot a cab driver.

question: Chicken shits. Ok, look
answer: Ok.

question: Hey, wait a minute! Bastard. Great. Perfect timing. Cassidy Daley.
answer: It's me. Jimmy.

question: Shit, Jimmy, I thought you were dead.
answer: Don't be silly. Listen

question: I did, but I don't really get it, what's "Sparrow"?
answer: It doesn't matter. Did you tell anyone else about this story?

question: Are you kidding? You think I want to share a story like this?
answer: Ok. Good. Cause the truth is, there is no story. I made the whole thing up. So you should just drop it...

question: Uh-uh, no way are you backing out on me now, Jimmy. This story is way too good... I'm at the Atlantic City Boardwalk. Actually, I'm in the trunk of my ex- husband's car. Long story. More importantly, where are you?
Sid's Bail Bonds.
answer: Guess who's in my trunk?

question: Is that some sort of perverted innuendo? Who is this?
answer: Aw, come on, Teresa, you know it's me. Put Sid on.

question: Sid's busy shopping. He thinks he can handle Xmas.
answer: Ok, just tell him I got her and I'll be back in 2 hours. I want a bonus for bringing her in so quick.

question: Yeah? I want a bonus for getting through the holidays without stabbing anyone with a fork.
answer: Don't be such a pessimist. You still have time. Gotta go. I got another call. Tina's Thai massage! Where every ending is a happy one!

question: Don't be such a pessimist. You still have time. Gotta go. I got another call. Tina's Thai massage! Where every ending is a happy one!
answer: You're disgusting. Let me out of the trunk.

question: Hmm. Nope. By the way, your boyfriend Stewart's been following me. Unfortunately, I had to ditch him at the track.
answer: Why is Stewart..? And wait

question: Aw, don't be embarrassed. These things happen. You were drunk when you guys hooked up, right?
answer: You know what, Milo? I shouldn't have run from you like that. I was...I don't know. You caught me off-guard. The truth is, I'm kind of in some trouble and I could really use your help.

question: Holy shit! Hey, um, Cass? Cassidy? It's Ok, hang on, I'm coming...
answer: You know something, Milo? You're one of the most gullible... Ow ow ow...

question: Son of a...
answer: NOOOO! Uncle, uncle, uncle! Dirty fighter.

question: Me? I'm the dirty fighter?
answer: Should we...I don't know...hug, or something?

question: Sure. What the hell.
answer: Hey. I had to try, right?

question: Your windshield's cracked.
answer: Thanks, Captain Obvious.

question: And you look like shit, Milo. What have you been doing, sleeping on the floor?
answer: I enjoy sleeping on the floor. Matter of fact, I love sleeping on the floor. I love everything about my life. Great job, good friends, hot girlfriend...

question: You have a girlfriend?
answer: Yes I do.

question: Really? What's her name?
answer: Teresa. Rocking hot body. Likes to cook pasta for me and perform strip- teases.

question: Wow. Is she missing a chromosome?
answer: Oh, she has all her chromosomes, believe you me.

question: Well, my life is great, too.
answer: I can tell. You and Stewart make a great couple, by the way. You and me made a terrible couple. But you two? Like peas in a pod.

question: You know what I like about Stewart?
answer: I can't imagine.

question: He's not you.
answer: Not even on his best day.

question: Or his worst.
answer: I'll bet he has a lot of those.

question: Still betting, huh?
answer: You can't win if you don't play.

question: Or, in your case, even if you do.
answer: I win all the time.

question: Really? I hadn't noticed.
answer: You know what? Seeing as how I'm about to come into five grand... I think I'll do a little betting right now.

question: Don't you have to take me back?
answer: Please. I have two days. A monkey could get you back in two days.

question: Aren't you afraid I'll get away?
answer: Nope.

question: Prepare to observe the master.
answer: Ok, how about this: If I give you all the cash in my wallet, will you let me go?

question: Hmm. Lemme see... Nope. Guess not. Hit me.
answer: I'd really like to. Nice going, master. Why would you think we were a couple?

question: We used to be together. Back when I was young and foolish.
answer: And I was confused.

question: And I was slumming.
answer: And I was drunk.

question: Wait. Champagne! I'm celebrating. Son of a bitch.
answer: Look, Milo, the truth is...my Mom is in the hospital.

question: Oh? Old Lois not feeling up to par?
answer: She might be really sick. That's why I had to jump bail.

question: Taking care of her, huh? Putting aside your career for a loved one? Golly, that's so you.
answer: You've already been to see her.

question: Impressive. No wonder you got all those awards. So lemme guess
answer: Stewart. Stewart told you. I wouldn't trust you if you were the last man alive.

question: You think about that much? Me being the last man alive? Am I naked in this fantasy?
answer: Ok, you're right. I'm on a story. A very important story. It just so happens that I'm possibly about to uncover a whole ring of dirty cops. What?

question: Please. Isn't the whole "dirty cop" thing kind of old? Maybe you should do a story about something people are interested in. Like internet porn. Or lesbians.
answer: I'm serious, Milo. This is gonna be big. And here's what I'm willing to do

question: Oh, sure, like you credited me in the 13th Street Article?
answer: Why on earth would I have credited you? I worked my ass off for that story.

question: That's one way of putting it.
answer: What's that supposed to mean?

question: Forget it. I don't want to be in your article. In fact, I would rather eat a bowl of broken glass than have my name in any way associated with one of your lousy articles...
answer: Fine. Forget I mentioned it.

question: I already have.
answer: I mean, you're not a cop anymore, right? What do you care if people were murdered?

question: Please. Nobody was murdered.
answer: Just my source. Well...

question: Dumped in a reservoir? Car accident?
answer: Ok, ok, maybe he wasn't murdered yet. But I wouldn't be surprised if... Maybe this whole thing sounds like no big deal to you...

question: You know what it sounds like? It sounds like you're going to jail.
answer: Milo, listen, you have to believe me, come on, you know me...

question: Exactly! I do know you. Which means I know you are a deceptive, cold- hearted bitch who is going to jail where she belongs.
answer: Can I have some privacy, please?

question: I'm gonna have to frisk you.
answer: Get it over with, then.

question: You gain a little weight?
answer: You lose a little hair? Yeah. Right. I'm hiding a weapon in my breasts.

question: Clever. Wow. You were gonna use all that stuff on me?
answer: A guy can dream, can't he?

question: Ok, look, Milo, let's just clear the air, Ok? So maybe it was a mistake, thinking we could be involved while working on the same case...
answer: Hey, I know it was a mistake. Don't think you're telling me something I don't know, cause you're not.

question: Ok. Fine. But can we just put aside our differences for two seconds? Because back at the casino, I think I saw someone following me.
answer: Sure that wasn't me?

question: I don't think so. This guy was lacking your trademark smell of booze and KFC.
answer: Ha ha.

question: Anywho. If these dirty cops have my source hostage somewhere... What's so funny?
answer: You think dirty cops are trying to kill you? Look, I know you think you're hot shit and everything, but I'm pretty sure the only one around here who might want to kill you is me.

question: Oh no.
answer: What?

question: Behind us. It's him. The guy I saw back at the casino.
answer: Yeah? He doesn't look like a cop to me.

question: Speed up!
answer: Would you just calm down for a second and...

question: NO!!
answer: Jesus christ... LISTEN, YOU MANIAC...

question: MILO!!!
answer: SHIT!!!

question: I told you they were trying to kill me!
answer: Yeah, well, no one's killing you until I get you to jail.

question: You're still taking me to jail? But it's the cops who are after me.
answer: First of all

question: But...this is important! This is my job!
answer: And this... is my job.

question: Milo, you don't understand what's going on!
answer: I'll lay it out for you Please. My brain can dance circles around your brain.

question: I don't even know what that means.
answer: Case closed. "Atlantic City. Xmas Eve. Sparrow." What's "Sparrow"?

question: I knew you couldn't figure it out. No.
answer: Casino.

question: Nope.
answer: Stripper?

question: I don't think so. What kind of strip bars have you been going to, anyway? Oh, well, forget it, I knew you couldn't do it.
answer: Please. I could crack that story and still get you to jail on time.

question: Oh yeah? Wanna bet?
answer: You're on. I have to make a call.

question: Hey. Aren't you going to uncuff me?
answer: Why? You going somewhere?

question: Um...no.
answer: Then you don't need to be uncuffed.

question: Asshole.
answer: So there's just gonna be a little delay...

question: I'll tell you what I'm doing
answer: You are so full of shit. You don't want your job back. You just want to prove you're smarter than she is.

question: I am smarter than she is. I would have cracked that 13th Street case way before she did if she hadn't...
answer: ...cheated, right, I know, you've told me a million times. Did it ever occur to you that a normal couple wouldn't compete the way you guys do in the first place?

question: This from the man currently trying to prove to his wife he can handle Xmas.
answer: I can handle Xmas!

question: Just..trust me, Ok?
answer: Do I have a choice?

question: Nope. So. Atlantic City. Xmas Eve... ...so what exactly are these dirty cops supposed to be doing?
answer: Stealing evidence from property rooms. Then destroying it, for the right price. What?

question: Nothing. It's just...it's a good idea. If it weren't, you know. Wrong. So. Your plan is to catch them red-handed before they can destroy the evidence, then write an expose for the paper and win yourself another big award.
answer: Something like that.

question: Only, you don't know what Sparrow is. Could be a nickname. Or the place where the evidence is stashed. Or a code word of some kind. But the guy who knows has gone missing, and you think the dirty cops got a hold of him. So we find your source, we find the dirty cops. Gimme your phone.
answer: What?

question: I need an address to go with a phone number. But I need it ASAP. Kinda got a guy on my tail...
answer: Pretty proud of yourself, ey?

question: Hey. You're a reporter. Great. But I used to be a cop. Let's face it
answer: You weren't last time.

question: What did you say?
answer: I said you're doing a great job. Ok, here's what I think we should do

question: Excellent plan. Oh, except you're staying in the car.
answer: But...it's my story! Asshole.

question: You Ok? My bad. Merry Xmas to you, too! Room service. What the...? What the hell are you doing? Yeah, well, you're paying for that.
answer: Oh, ok. Here's a nickle.

question: Perfect. Play along. This is like the third card they've given me...
answer: Take it easy, honey...

question: Don't tell me to take it easy, now we have to go all the way downstairs again... Davenport. Room 2505. You're an angel.
answer: I don't have one.

question: Then you've answered your own question.
answer: Come on, give me something. You've got, like, a million weapons in the jacket.

question: Hey. These are not toys. You can't just give them to someone and have them know how to use them.
answer: I seem to remember doing just fine with your taser gun. Oh, god, is that blood?

question: Hey. Columbo. Wait by the door.
answer: I'm just trying to...

question: This could be a crime scene. There are clues all over this room that only a trained eye can find. And as I seem to recall, you were the one who was unable to figure this out by herself.
answer: He is unbelievable.

question: Who are you talking to, your imaginary friend Leslie? Whatever. You wait by the door. And I'll handle this.
answer: So you're saying you don't want my help.

question: I'm saying I don't need your help. What was that? Did you find something?
answer: How could I find anything? I'm not the detective.

question: Ok, so some guy you're looking for has disappeared. You want me to put out an all-points on him?
answer: The thing is, Bob

question: Whoa, whoa, whoa. You're with Cassidy? Shit, Milo, you know when you're around her your brain turns to mush.
answer: Yeah, well, that doesn't change the fact that someone took a couple shots at us.

question: You get a plate number?
answer: Happened too quick. But it was a dark 4-door Chevy, blue or grey, New Jersey plates, and the car was wrecked, I know that.

question: Ok. Lemme look into it. See what I can find. Just hold tight, Ok?
answer: Ok. But we're kinda on a clock here.

question: Can I get a whiskey?
answer: Make that two.

question: After we broke up, I was so mad at you, I told everyone I know you have herpes.
answer: I told everyone you flunked out of 3rd grade.

question: I told everyone you have a moustache.
answer: I told everyone you like to wear my panties.

question: Hey!
answer: Wow. This would be really awkward if we still had feelings for each other. Which we don't...

question: That's right. Luckily, we're different people now. We don't feel the way we used to.
answer: Right. We've moved on.

question: We have no feelings about each other whatsoever. Just two people who used to know each other.
answer: Two casual acquaintances.

question: Feels good, doesn't it?
answer: Feels fantastic.

question: A platonic relationship. Working together.
answer: Helping each other.

question: Trusting each other.
answer: Well. Mind if I shower?

question: Sheryl?
answer: No, not Sheryl. Cass. Your daughter.

question: Jesus Christ, where the hell are ya, Niagara Falls?
answer: No. You're not gonna believe this, but Mom...

question: I always knew you two would...
answer: Mom. We're not back together.

question: Why the hell not? I mean, I just don't get it, you're in this romantic place, you have a perfect opportunity to win him back...
answer: Why should I have to win him back? He should have to win me back! And who says I want him back, anyway?

question: I have never understood this competitive streak of yours...
answer: Look, the reason I called

question: That was a long time ago! And all I did was serve drinks...
answer: I just need to know the name of the place.

question: Charley's. And Ok, I admit, maybe I did a little dancing, but how often do you make 200 an hour in tips?
answer: I gotta go.

question: Sneaky bitch.
answer: Sneaky bastard.

question: Good shower?
answer: The best.

question: Great.
answer: You know what's great? Trusting each other.

question: I agree. Time for bed! Excuse me. What are you doing?
answer: Um...

question: Are you trying to seduce me? Really? Wow. That's great news. You know what would be really sexy right now?
answer: If we both just went to sleep?

question: No. If you talked dirty to me.
answer: Ok. Sewage. Mold. Rotting carcass...

question: No, I mean, tell me about your attraction to me.
answer: Um...I can't stop thinking about you.

question: Really? What part of me?
answer: Just...all of you.

question: Be specific. My gun? I knew I couldn't trust you!
answer: I knew I couldn't trust you!

question: When were you gonna tell me about the matches you found back there in the hotel room?
answer: When were you gonna tell me you have no intention of helping me with my story? Oh my god, would you get over it already! So I cracked the case before you did, it was 3 years ago, it happened, stop being such a baby and move on!

question: Really? Cause it did make me wonder...
answer: Why do you care? Listen to me

question: I quit my job.
answer: You were fired.

question: Shit. What was that about?
answer: Nothing. I had her add mayo to your burger. I remember you like that.

question: Oh. Thanks. Ok, look
answer: Depends on the person.

question: Whadya mean?
answer: Well, if the person you're referring to is you, I agree

question: This burger...
answer: One day stuff like that is gonna kill ya. Who knows? Maybe even today.

question: My tug...is thwelling... I tink dere might be sesame...
answer: Yeah, I had her add that with the mayo. Is that bad? Oh wait, you're violently allergic to sesame. Whoops. My bad. You know what that is? "Karma". Oh, and, I'll get the story. Watch me. 911? Yeah, there's a guy here about to go into anaphylactic shock. Better hurry. Yeah, "Charley's". On the boardwalk? Great. Thanks.

question: Oh, I understand, alright, and I don't blame ya. I want to hurt her all the time.
answer: Milo, listen, they're not kidding, Ok?

question: Ok. Fine. Say you were wrong.
answer: For what?

question: For what? For poisoning me with sesame and almost killing me!
answer: Ok. Maybe that was not the best...

question: Say you were wrong.
answer: I could have found a more mature...

question: Say you were wrong.
answer: I was possibly out of line...

question: Say you were wrong.
answer: Ok, ok, I was wrong!

question: Ok. Now. Admit that the only reason you were able to crack that case three years ago was because you looked through my files.
answer: What?

question: I think I'll hang up now... Thrilled. Now tell them I'll be there in 20 minutes. Meanwhile, stop shifting in your seat like that and just tell them you have to use the bathroom. Don't look around. Just do it.
answer: You boys mind if I use the ladies room?

question: You know what my mistake was? I never should have let you out of the trunk. I'm fine, by the way. The doctor said I may have been technically dead for a few seconds, but I'm fine now.
answer: So that's what you really think? That I stole information from you?

question: It's not what I think, it's what I know. How else did you beat me?
answer: Did it ever occur to you that I just might be good at my job? That's what I thought. You know what, Milo? You're an even bigger asshole than I previously suspected, and you deserve everything that's happened to you. And everything that's about to happen to you.

question: Yeah?
answer: What the fuck are you doing? I thought I told you to lie low.

question: I was lying low...
answer: Yeah? Then how is it that a statewide all-points was just put out on the two of you? Ok, look, you guys better come to me, I'll protect you til we figure this out. Can you get to Pier 19?

question: Yeah.
answer: Get in.

question: And we think they're ditching it tonight.
answer: Hey, man. I got mouths to feed.

question: Aw. That's what all the dirty cops say.
answer: You've always been such a stubborn asshole, Milo. You just don't listen. All you had to do was stay where I told you and none of this would have happen. Now the two of you are gonna have to go down with the boat. Ok. Guess that's it. Gotta go. You know what? You guys make a great couple.

question: What's so funny?
answer: My mom was worried I wouldn't have plans for Xmas Eve.

question: Hey, are you crying? Ok, just don't...
answer: I'm not crying.

question: I know you're not.
answer: I just... I can't believe I going to die by being blown up and sinking to the bottom of the ocean with someone who thinks I'm a total liar.

question: We're not gonna die.
answer: Oh yeah? What's the plan?

question: Ok. Here's what we do. We're going to synchronize our efforts in order to cross the room and manipulate the bomb out of the room and into the water in order to diffuse the explosive impact.
answer: You mean we're going to throw the bomb out the window?

question: Uh, yeah. Or we can just wait to get blown up. That's the spirit. Ok, first we're going sideways Ok. My left this time... Now we're gonna work our way over to the bomb. And I don't think you're a total liar, but in my own defense, I was one of the top detectives in my division, I had been working that case for months, and then you just waltzed in and solved it.
answer: I didn't just "waltz in". You know I had been working it for months, too. Isn't it possible that we're both good at our jobs, and I just happened to come out ahead? Well, neither had I! Ow...

question: Shit..
answer: Dammit... Milo?

question: My right. So. You were in love with me?
answer: Of course I was in love with you, why do you think I married you? Oh. My. God. You think I married you so I could get info on the case? Who am I, Mata Hari? She's a spy, Milo.

question: Well. It might be a little late for this. But...nice job on the article.
answer: You know, if I had something sharp right now, I would stab you.

question: No, really, I mean, it was well- written and...
answer: Can you just get us out of here, please? Umph...

question: Ughh...
answer: Son of a...

question: Ow...
answer: Can you see the bomb?

question: Uh, yeah. I can see the bomb. Now we get up.
answer: Did you throw it?

question: Not exactly.
answer: Well, what are you waiting for?

question: I'm waiting for a pig to fly in here and grab it.
answer: Milo...

question: Ok, Ok. Um, on 3, I need you to jump.
answer: What?

question: You know
answer: Are you serious?

question: No. I'm fucking with you. For fun. Just for my own personal enjoyment...
answer: Ok, Ok.

question: Ok
answer: Think the water defused it?

question: Lemme ask you this? Has anything gone our way yet?
answer: Nice job.

question: Hey. You, too.
answer: Thanks.

question: Now lets find something to cut these ropes off...
answer: Think we can catch that cop?

question: Trust me Hey, Bobby. I got one for ya... What's the difference between a snowman and a snowwoman? The spark plug. Merry Xmas. I got you this.
answer: You shouldn't have.

question: Hey. I've still got three hours to get you to jail. Looks like I'm gonna win that bet after all. You have got to be kidding me.
answer: (muffled, face in the

question: Yeah. I'm getting that. 9am. See? Easy as pie. Go on, say it.
answer: I'd like to turn myself in. Though I didn't do anything wrong...

question: Stop talking.
answer: ...and I was unjustly arrested...

question: See ya.
answer: Oh. Ok.

question: Ah, what the hell.
answer: Oh my god, what happened?

question: Hey. I couldn't let you spend Xmas alone. Besides, I didn't really have any plans other than drinking some cheap whiskey and putting my fist through a wall.
answer: I'm touched that you would give that up for me.
